main event: On October 10, 1952, an airman in Manston, England, observed a silver object hovering motionless for 8 minutes before rolling on its side and disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as disc-shaped, silver-gray, and approximately 80-100 feet in diameter.
It was seen hovering and performing circular patterns at very high speeds before suddenly accelerating and shooting out of sight with no sound heard.
The sighting was made by pilots and observers of a RAF fighter unit near Manston, England on October 6, 1952.
The object was observed by both pilots and ground observers simultaneously over the base.
The report mentions that an analysis of this sighting is being made.
witnesses: pilots and observers from a RAF fighter unit
